Image2Characters.filterCharacterRegions.FilterCharacterRegions¶

class Image2Characters.filterCharacterRegions.FilterCharacterRegions(npImage=None)[source]¶

From one image representing a possible plate get the rectangles in which letters/number are located. Inherits: InitialCharacterRegions which containts methods that produce lots of initial rectangles INPUT: gray scale image as numpy array OUTPUT: list of possible plates in this image each possible plate is a list of six rectangles

__init__(npImage=None)[source]¶
Parameters:npImage – numpy array of image

Methods

__init__([npImage])
param npImage:numpy array of image
checkArea([minArea, maxArea]) letters with too small/large area are killed
checkHeight([minHeight]) to short letters are killed
checkSameness([toleranceInPixel]) if we have almost the same rectange, kill one of them
checkSixXcloseness([minFraction, maxFraction]) check that subsequent rectangles are close/far enought in x-direction
checkWidth([minWidth, maxWidth]) to broad or narrow letters are killed
descew(area) descew an image based on contours, works for clean images
descew_histo(area[, minAng, maxAng]) descew based on maximising standard deviation
determineSetsOfSix([heightCriterium]) get all possible 6-sets of letters that are close each other in height
getCharacterRegion() return the area of six chacters/digits
getClone()
getCurrentSixLists() current candidates for character regions
getFinalListSixLists() give Final result of character regions for a plate ordered from left to right
getInitialRegionsByContours()
getInitialRegionsFast() http://opencv-python-tutroals.readthedocs.io/en/latest/py_tutorials/py_feature2d/py_fast/py_fast.html#fast
getInitialRegionsMser() get rectangles of possible characters
getInitialRegionsSIFT() surface detection, works only with contributed stuff in opencv3
getRegions()
imageToPlatesWithCharacterRegions() from a given numpy array representing the image possibly containing licence plate(s),
plateChars2CharacterRegions() from a given numpy array representing the image possibly containing licence plate(s),
reset([npImage]) Start from a new image as numpy array
setImageFromFile(imageFileName[, ...]) for debugging: image can be read from file also
showAllRectangles([clone, regions]) show image with current rectangles on it
showFinalRectangles() show image with final rectangles on it
showIntermediateRectangles() show image with current rectangles on it
sortSetsAndToList() sort charactar regions in each plate by x coordinate
writeAllRectangles([clone, regions]) write all current rectangles to disk individually
writeFinalRectangles() write final rectangles to disk individually
writeIntermediateRectangles() write all current rectangles to disk individually
